data.title: Fardeen Khan reacts to Zeenat Aman’s revelation about his father Feroz Khan deducting her payment on 'Qurbani' set
data.meta_description: Zeenat Aman recounted an incident where Feroz Khan docked her pay for being an hour late to the set, showcasing his suave demeanor.
data.text:
Synopsis

Zeenat Aman recounted an incident where Feroz Khan docked her pay for being an hour late to the set, showcasing his suave demeanor.

Fardeen Khan, the son of the late Bollywood icon Feroz Khan, has candidly responded to veteran actress Zeenat Aman's recent Instagram post, reminiscing about her time working with the charismatic actor-director.

Zeenat Aman shared her experiences from the 70s, including an incident where Feroz Khan deducted her pay for arriving an hour late on the set of their film Qurbani.

Zeenat Aman initiated her post by acknowledging Feroz Khan's charisma, stating, "I read somewhere that Oxford’s word for the year 2023 is 'rizz' - short for charisma. Well, if I’ve ever known anybody to have rizz, it was Feroz Khan."

She then delved into the initial challenges in their relationship, recounting a telephone conversation where she politely declined a secondary role offered by Feroz.

Despite the rocky start, Feroz Khan later offered Zeenat the lead role in 'Qurbani'. She fondly shared a behind-the-scenes anecdote when Feroz "docked" her pay due to a one-hour delay caused by her youthful exuberance. She admitted, "No argument, no scolding, but you can be sure that he docked my pay to pay the crew for that one-hour delay."

Feroz Khan's son, Fardeen Khan, took to Instagram to respond to Zeenat Aman's revelations. He humorously quipped, "Zeenat Aman aunty, if it's any consolation, family wasn't spared either. We just received the standard family discount of 25%. Khan Saab would have loved your post. He would have laughed out loud."

Fardeen Khan's Instagram Story

Feroz Khan, often hailed as the "Clint Eastwood of India," was a prominent figure in Bollywood, renowned for his style and contributions to over 60 films, both as an actor and director.

He passed away in 2009 after battling lung cancer. 'Qurbani', a film directed by Feroz Khan and featuring Zeenat Aman, remains a cherished project in their filmography. Released in 1980, the movie explored themes of friendship, betrayal, and revenge and achieved commercial success during its time.

Zeenat Aman, celebrated for her iconic roles in films like 'Roti Kapada Aur Makaan', 'Ajnabee', and 'Satyam Shivam Sundaram', continues to share her experiences from the golden era of Bollywood. As she gears up for her next project, 'Bun Tikki', fans eagerly anticipate more glimpses into the enchanting world of Indian cinema from this seasoned actress.
